item.title: Love, Death & Robots - A Stunning Anthology
item.description:
First Impressions: Love, Death & Robots

Just started Season 1 of Love, Death & Robots ‚Äì a visually stunning anthology blending sci-fi, fantasy, and dark humor. Each episode is a self-contained story with unique animation styles, from hyper-realistic CGI to striking hand-drawn art.

Today’s Watchlist:

  • S01E01: Sonnie’s Edge (Brutal monster fights & a killer twist)
  • S01E02: Three Robots (Darkly funny post-apocalyptic tour)
  • S01E03: The Witness (Mind-bending chase in a neon dystopia)

The series‚Äô creativity and unpredictability already have me hooked. Perfect for fans of Black Mirror but with more visceral animation.

item.title: nts:25-06
item.description:
nts:25-06

üí£ Brutal Truth: Most people stay broke, mediocre, and powerless‚Äîaddicted to comfort. They hit snooze, scroll endlessly, binge shows, eat junk, dodge challenges, and wait for the ‚Äúright time.‚Äù

They lack discipline, structure, systems. They won‚Äôt invest in themselves.

But you‚Äôre not most people.

One decision separates you from transformation or another year of excuses. Take the 30-Day Level Up Challenge‚Äîa proven system to break limits and rebuild your mind.

item.title: nts:25-05
item.description:
nts:25-05

Even when it feels slow… keep going.

You’re not behind, you’re not failing, you’re just building something that takes time.

Some days will feel like shadows, while others will remind you of your fire.

But every step, every breath, every quiet act of showing up‚Äîis a silent roar that says: I‚Äôm not done yet.

Your pace doesn’t define your power.

Keep going. Your win is warming up. üó£Ô∏èüîâüîä

item.title: nts:25-04
item.description:
Note To Self

What if I told you 30 days could make you unrecognizable?

Not by magic, but by war against the version of you playing small, stuck on ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not ready,‚Äù negotiating with destiny.

It‚Äôs not up for debate.

The cost of your new life is your old one. Stop negotiating. üßè‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

There‚Äôs a version of you the world hasn‚Äôt seen, hidden behind doubt and distractions. That ends now.

item.title: nts:25-03
item.description:
Note To Self

No one stumbles into a beautiful life. You build it‚Äîstep by step.

That quiet alley you‚Äôre walking through? It may feel narrow, lonely, or endless. But it‚Äôs leading somewhere. Somewhere brighter.

Don‚Äôt wait for the perfect moment. Don‚Äôt wait for life to hand you joy, success, or peace. The truth is, you have to chase it. You have to move‚Äîeven if the pace is slow, even if the road is uncertain.

item.title: 5 Steps to Become a Millionaire in 10 Years
item.description:
5 Steps to Become a Millionaire in 10 Years

Imagine standing 10 years from now, a millionaire, looking back at a journey that transformed your life. Success isn‚Äôt luck‚Äîit‚Äôs a path forged by intentional action. Commit to these five steps, and your transformation is within reach.

1. Move Out of Your Hometown

Your environment shapes your reality. Step into the unknown to:

  • Expand your imagination with new challenges.
  • Meet people who inspire growth.
  • Transform your perspective with new realities.
    Leaving isn‚Äôt just escape‚Äîit‚Äôs rising.

2. Connect with High-Value People

Your network is your net worth. Elevate yourself first:

item.title: Setting Up SSH Keys for a VPS
item.description:
Introduction

Using SSH keys to access your Virtual Private Server (VPS) is one of the most secure methods of authentication. SSH keys provide a stronger layer of security compared to password logins by utilizing a cryptographic key pair. This guide will walk you through generating SSH keys, copying them to your server, and disabling password logins to enhance security.

Step 1: Generate SSH Keys

Before you can use SSH key-based authentication, you need to generate an SSH key pair on your local machine.

item.title: My Rubik's Cube (Part 1)
item.description:
The Cube

Recently, I decided to buy myself a Rubik’s Cube and see how easy or hard solving it would be. In this series of mini-posts, I‚Äôll share my experience and the steps I followed to solve the cube.

The Challenge

When I first held the cube and scrambled it, I realized that solving it was going to be more than just a quick puzzle. It requires a methodical approach and an algorithm. After some research and watching YouTube videos, I found the Beginner’s Method to be the best way to start. But first, I needed to understand the notations used when solving the cube.

item.title: Weeknote 2024:33
item.description:
I recently explored dotfiles and learned how to set them up with version control using Git. I applied this to my bash files (e.g., .bashrc, .bash_aliases) and configured my dotfiles so that I can easily use them on any system. This is achieved by pulling from my Git repository and symlinking the dotfiles to their original locations on the system.

I also discovered that this approach can be extended to configuration files‚Äîthe dotfiles for packages installed on Linux. This means that whenever I install a package, I can add its dotfile to my dotfile directory.

item.title: Building My Site/Blog (Parr 1)
item.description:
Today, I successfully set up this site/blog.

As a Python enthusiast, I used Pelican, a static site generator, to create and deploy this site/blog to GitHub Pages.

The process was both fun and informative, and I’ll be documenting it here.

To get started, you’ll need the following:

  1. A GitHub account.
  2. A Linux environment (I used Termux on my phone since I don’t have a laptop).
  3. Python installed.

Let’s begin by creating a repository on GitHub named:
